frameDefinitions: This frame contains words for individuals, i.e. humans, with respect to their Religion.
A Toxic_substance causes death or harm when introduced into or absorbed by a living organism, the Victim.
An Assailant attacks a Victim, intending to die in the process.
This frame has similarities to Experiencer_subject, but here the verbs are more 'active' in meaning.
An Agent has a choice of whether or not to participate in some Desirable_event because of an Opportunity, a situation not completely under the Agent's control and usually of a limited duration.
A Terrorist commits a violent or otherwise harmful Act upon a Victim in order to coerce or terrorize a government or populace.
frameExamples: The bells call the <t><fex name='Person'>faithful</fex></t> to evensong DNI
The  main product , sulphide , is <t>toxic</t> to cells
The terrorist <t>suicide attack</t> on U.S. troops early last week caused more damage than initially reported.
Pat is still <t>worrying</t> about the exam.
It would be pleasant in the <t>opportune</t> absence of the clergyman to have a dance . DNI
Their <t>terrorism</t> against civilians will not be tolerated.
listRoleDefinitions: The religious belief system that the <fen>Person</fen> follows.
The <fen>Victim</fen> is the being or entity that is capable of being harmed by the <fen>Toxic_substance</fen>.
This role marks expressions that indicate the substance which potentially causes harm to a <fen>Victim</fen>.
A living organism, object or process that produces a <fen>Toxic_substance</fen>.
This <fen>Victim</fen> is the being or entity that is injured by the <fen>Assailant</fen>'s suicide attack.
The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the <fen>Victim</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Assailant</fen> makes an assault on the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The role <fen>Experiencer</fen> indicates the one who is actively expressing emotion over the <fen>Topic</fen>.  It usually occurs as the subject of the verb.
The Experiencer's emotion generally is about something.  This is indicated with a <fen>Topic</fen> which usually occurs in a PP-Complement.
The situation during which the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen> is possible. For nominal LUs, this is generally in the second layer and contains the target.
The sentient agent that may or may not participate in the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen>.
A situation or event that the <fen>Agent</fen> can participating in during the period of the <fen>Opportunity</fen>.
The <fen>Terrorist</fen> commits the <fen>Act</fen> of terror for political or ideological gains.
The <fen>Act</fen> is the harmful action performed by the <fen>Terrorist</fen> or terrorist organization.
The <fen>Victim</fen> is most directly affected or harmed by the <fen>Act</fen> of terrorism.
The location in time when the <fen>Act</fen> takes place.
The location where the <fen>Act</fen> takes place.
listRoleExamples: Chocolate can be poisonous <fex>for some types of pets</fex>.
Highly toxic <fex>pollutants</fex> could be safely disposed of by burning them
A young man was bitten by a poisonous <fex>snake</fex> and lives to tell about it.
Her suicide attack <fex>on the guardsmen</fex> was the third such attack in the last month.
<fex>The group's</fex> suicide attacks continue to affect troop morale.
<fex>Last Tuesday's</fex> suicide attack killed seven and wounded 20.
Last week's suicide bombing <fex>outside the city</fex> was the first in weeks.
Several domestic <fex>terrorists</fex> were operating from the site during the mid 1990s.
Many have suffered due to their acts of <fex><t>terrorism</t></fex>.
Cowardly acts of terrorism <fex>upon innocent men, women, and children</fex> is not a doorway to Heaven, but a gateway to Hell.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Terror in France: The Rise of Jihad
